ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 560
ygData.msgSnippet: In my experiences in unrest vs. Ghoulroot spells, i ve noticed that maybe more than 50% of the time that strength returns to your legs as i start selo s. I
ygData.messageBody:
In my experiences in unrest vs. Ghoulroot spells, i've noticed that maybe
more than 50% of the time that "strength returns to your legs" as i start
selo's.

I pulled two ghouls and a dark boned skel to the zone, as it was very early
in the morning. I got one down to nearly nothing, then got rooted. I
immediately started selo's in hopes that it once again save me. I do believe
that it was NO coincidence. Besides, I did also notice that once I got to
the other side (dagnor's), I was again rooted. Hmm...

Pava, Bard of the 18th measure
Silent Dragons
Cazic Thule


>Actually, my friend I think you are mistaken. I'm
>pretty sure I have read even Brad say that selo's
>originally was supposed to break root. Now, it
>doesn't probably because the sow folks complained that
>bards were too powerful which is BS.
>
>Anyway, I got rooted last night by something and I
>couldn't break it by starting up selo's. It did,
>however, work against my wizard friend's root. Or at
>least it appeared to. And this was by starting up
>selo's AFTER the root was in place. Since he is 4
>levels higher than me I'd be surprised if I was
>breaking it on my own with some strange magic
>resistance that I don't know of.
